result.execSummary:
The defendant Levi A. Alt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Complete a 24- or 26-week domestic abuse class.

Pay costs.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

1 day credit in the event of revocation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
9:58 a.m.  Defendant Levi A. Alt in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def has completed counsel and plea waiver forms, and presents both to Court.  Court conducts waivers.  Def pleads no contest.  Further colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence withheld for probation of 1 year with conditions of d.a. class 24 to 26 weeks long.  Other conditions to include payment of costs.  Def to sign up for probation today after submitting DNA sample at RCSD.  1 day credit in the event of revocation.

15TR1865 dismissed.

9:45 a.m.  Defendant Levi A. Alt in court without counsel.  Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  AIA in 15Cm213 and status in 15TR1865.  Court notes that parties previously indicated they had a plea agreement.  ADA confirms - states that, if def pleads to charge, she'd be asking for 12 mo probation with d.a. class.  Def states he wants to accept that offer; states he is presently on probation and inquires as to whether the probation would run concurrent.  Def is presently unemployed and would qualify for SPD.  Court conducts counsel waiver colloquy and directs def to complete waiver of attorney form.
Rec'd letter from def today, says ADA told him he could reschedule today's hearing as well as she had no plea agreement ready for him.  Clerk checked with DA's office, will reset AIA to 2/17 @3:30.
Def called. ADA told him he could reschedule today's hearing as she had no plea agreement ready for him. Reset to 01/20/16 @ 3:30.
Previous no contact conditions of bond with KG and JG have been removed.
Previous no contact conditions of bond with KG and JG have been removed.

Defendant Levi A. Alt in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court states charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights including right to counsel.  Court adj. to 1/15 at 3:30.  Victim adresses Court; asks for no contact to be lifted.  No objection from ADA Forehand.  No contact with KG and JG struck from the bond.  Court adj. to 1/15 at 3:30.
